info.name: Dynatrace Configuration API
info.description:
Documentation of the Dynatrace Configuration API. To read about use-cases and examples, refer to the [help page](https://dt-url.net/4u43kxw).

Notes about compatibility:
* Operations marked as early adopter or preview may be changed in non-compatible ways, although we try to avoid this.
* We may add new enum constants without incrementing the API version; thus, clients need to handle unknown enum constants gracefully.

item.name: alerting Profiles
{id}
Gets the properties of the specified alerting profile | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required alerting profile.

response.name: Success

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Updates an existing alerting profile | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the alerting profile to be updated.

request.description: If an alerting profile with the specified ID doesn't exist, a new one is created.

response.name: Success. The new alerting profile has been created. The response contains the ID of the new alerting profile.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Failed. The input is invalid.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the alerting profile to be deleted.

request.description: The default alerting profile cannot be deleted.

response.name: Success. The alerting profile has been deleted. Response doesn't have a body.

{id}

response.name: Success

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Updates an existing metric event or creates a new one | maturity=EARLY_ADOPTER

variable.description:
(Required) The ID of the metric event to be updated.

 If you also set the ID in the body, it must match this ID.

request.description:
If the metric event with the specified ID does not exist, a new metric event will be created. 

 You can't update the **type** of the metric event.

response.name: Success. The metric event has been updated. The response is empty.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.name: Success. The new metric event has been created. The response contains the ID of the newly created metric event

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: error Rules
Gets the configuration of error rules in the specified application

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the required web application.

response.name: Success

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.body:
{
 "customErrorRules": [
  {
   "capture": false,
   "customAlerting": false,
   "impactApdex": true,
   "keyMatcher": "ENDS_WITH",
   "keyPattern": "aliquip pariatur",
   "valuePattern": "veniam incididunt in Ut ad",
   "valueMatcher": "CONTAINS"
  },
  {
   "capture": true,
   "customAlerting": false,
   "impactApdex": true,
   "keyMatcher": "CONTAINS",
   "keyPattern": "dolor ad cupidatat sint sed",
   "valuePattern": "mollit et dolore ex exer",
   "valueMatcher": "CONTAINS"
  }
 ],
 "httpErrorRules": [
  {
   "capture": false,
   "considerForAi": true,
   "considerUnknownErrorCode": true,
   "filterByUrl": true,
   "impactApdex": false,
   "considerBlockedRequests": false,
   "errorCodes": "400",
   "filter": "BEGINS_WITH",
   "url": "sit d"
  },
  {
   "capture": true,
   "considerForAi": false,
   "considerUnknownErrorCode": true,
   "filterByUrl": false,
   "impactApdex": false,
   "considerBlockedRequests": true,
   "errorCodes": "400",
   "filter": "EQUALS",
   "url": "ut nostrud fugiat"
  }
 ],
 "ignoreCustomErrorsInApdexCalculation": false,
 "ignoreHttpErrorsInApdexCalculation": true,
 "ignoreJavaScriptErrorsInApdexCalculation": false
}

item.name: Updates the configuration of error rules in the specified application

body.raw:
{
    "customErrorRules": [
        {
            "capture": true,
            "customAlerting": false,
            "impactApdex": false,
            "keyMatcher": "BEGINS_WITH",
            "keyPattern": "exercitation commodo laboris dolore",
            "valuePattern": "commodo culpa ipsum Duis in",
            "valueMatcher": "EQUALS"
        },
        {
            "capture": false,
            "customAlerting": false,
            "impactApdex": true,
            "keyMatcher": "EQUALS",
            "keyPattern": "enim elit p",
            "valuePattern": "enim amet",
            "valueMatcher": "CONTAINS"
        }
    ],
    "httpErrorRules": [
        {
            "capture": false,
            "considerForAi": true,
            "considerUnknownErrorCode": false,
            "filterByUrl": true,
            "impactApdex": false,
            "considerBlockedRequests": true,
            "errorCodes": "ullamco",
            "filter": "CONTAINS",
            "url": "laboris minim Ut commodo consectetur"
        },
        {
            "capture": false,
            "considerForAi": true,
            "considerUnknownErrorCode": false,
            "filterByUrl": false,
            "impactApdex": false,
            "considerBlockedRequests": false,
            "errorCodes": "enim do",
            "filter": "CONTAINS",
            "url": "sit in deserunt Excepteur"
        }
    ],
    "ignoreCustomErrorsInApdexCalculation": "<boolean>",
    "ignoreHttpErrorsInApdexCalculation": "<boolean>",

request.description:

The failure detection parameter set used by the rule must exist at the time of rule creation.

variable.description:
(Required) The name of the queue manager to be updated. 

 The name of the queue manager in the body of the request must match this name.

request.description: If the queue manager with the specified ID doesnt exist, a new queue manager will be created.

response.name: Success. The queue manager has been updated. Response doesn't have a body.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

item.name: Lists all available queue managers

request.description:
This endpoint is used to provide Dynatrace with your IBM MQ setup regarding alias, remote and cluster queues. 

 This is required to facilitate end to end tracing for messages send via IBM MQ where sender and receiver use different queue names. Without this information Dynatrace would still trace all requests, but would not be able to stitch service calls that use these IBM MQ features.

response.name: Success

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
